name: ClpMatrixBase
brief:
Abstract base class for constraint matrices in Clp

Defines the interface that all matrix types must implement for use with
Clp algorithms. The abstraction allows specialized matrix formats that
exploit structure (network, GUB, ±1 matrices) while providing a uniform
interface to the simplex solver.

algorithms.name:
Partial Pricing Support:
For very large problems, pricing all columns is expensive.
Matrix provides partial pricing interface:
  - partialPricing(start, end): Price subset of columns
  - startFraction_/endFraction_: Current search window
  - savedBestDj_: Best reduced cost found so far
algorithms.complexity:
Matrix-vector products: O(nnz) for general sparse,
  O(n) for network, O(nnz) but faster constant for ±1.

Key virtual methods:
- times(), transposeTimes(): Matrix-vector multiplication (y = A*x, y = A'*x)
- subsetTransposeTimes(): Partial BTRAN for steepest edge pricing
- getPackedMatrix(): Access underlying CoinPackedMatrix
- scale(): Apply row/column scaling

see: ClpPackedMatrix for standard sparse matrix (wraps CoinPackedMatrix)
ClpGubMatrix for generalized upper bound structure
CoinPackedMatrix in CoinUtils for sparse storage format
